Class ChessBoard

java.lang.Object
domain.ChessBoard
public class ChessBoard extends Object
Class responsible for building the board, turns and timers
Author:
Joaquim Simoes, nº54599, Diogo Mateus, nº53374

  • Method Details

    • update

      public void update(ChessMove cm) throws IllegalMoveException
      Updates the board with the ChessMove made
      Parameters:
      cm - Move of the type ChessMove with the new position for a ChessPiece
      Throws:
      IllegalMoveException - Thrown if the ChessMove given is illegal

    • validMoveCheck

      public boolean validMoveCheck(ChessMove cm)
      This function checks the validity of a ChessMove according to the ChessPieceKind's chess rules
      Parameters:
      cm - Move of the type ChessMove given to the ChessPiece
      Returns:
      Will return true if the ChessMove was validated and false if not

    • checkInBounds

      public boolean checkInBounds(ChessMove cm)
      This function checks if the ChessMove given to a Piece don't cross the limits of the board
      Parameters:
      cm - Move of the type ChessMove given to the ChessPiece
      Returns:
      Will return true if the move given is inside the board's limits or false if it isn't

    • intToChar

      public char intToChar(int n)
      This function is responsible for converting an int to a char value
      Parameters:
      n - An int from '0' to '7' that represents the numeric value of the column of the ChessPiece's position on the board
      Returns:
      A char value from 'a' to 'h' that represents the column in the 2D ChessBoard array

    • getNextTurn

      public int getNextTurn()
      Get the phone number of the player that will play next
      Returns:
      Returns the phone number of the next player to play based on the last one who played

    • getLastTurnColor

      public Color getLastTurnColor()
      Get the color of the last turn's player

    • getPiece

      public String getPiece(int i, int j)
      Gets a string with the name of the ChessPiece given a position on the board
      Parameters:
      i - An int representing an horizontal position on the board
      j - An int representing a vertical position on the board
      Returns:
      Returns a string with the name of the piece in that position, null if position is empty

    • getPieceObj

      public ChessPiece getPieceObj(int i, int j)
      Gets the ChessPiece object given a position on the board
      Parameters:
      i - An int representing an horizontal position on the board
      j - An int representing a vertical position on the board
      Returns:
      Returns the ChessPiece object in that position, null if position is empty

    • updatePlayer

      public boolean updatePlayer(ChessMove cm, ChessPlayer cp) throws IllegalMoveException
      This method is responsible for updating the player's turn if the move was made correctly
      Parameters:
      cm - Move of the type ChessMove given to the ChessPiece
      cp - Player of the type ChessPlayer that is currently playing
      Returns:
      Returns true if the player status was updated, false if it wasn't
      Throws:
      IllegalMoveException - Thrown if the move a player is trying to make is illegal
